hysteresisHelp.title: Understanding Hysteresis
hysteresisHelp.whatIsItExplanation: Hysteresis is a temperature buffer that prevents your heating system from constantly turning on and off. This rapid cycling (called 'short cycling') can damage equipment like boilers, relays, thermostatic valves, and reduce their lifespan significantly.
hysteresisHelp.howItWorksExplanation: Instead of turning heating on/off at exactly the target temperature, hysteresis creates a band. Heating turns ON when temperature falls below (target - hysteresis), and turns OFF when it reaches the target.
hysteresisHelp.exampleText: Target: 19.2¬∞C, Hysteresis: 0.5¬∞C ‚Üí Heating starts at 18.7¬∞C, stops at 19.2¬∞C
hysteresisHelp.radiatorExplanation: Radiators have low thermal mass and respond quickly to changes. They heat up and cool down within minutes. Without hysteresis, they would cycle on/off very frequently, wearing out components.
hysteresisHelp.floorExplanation: Floor heating systems have high thermal mass (concrete, screed). They take hours to heat up or cool down. The thermal inertia naturally prevents rapid cycling. The floor continues radiating heat even after heating stops.
hysteresisHelp.floorRecommendation: Recommended: 0.1-0.3¬∞C (minimal delay) or even use global 0.5¬∞C - the floor's thermal mass provides natural protection against short cycling
hysteresisHelp.globalSettingExplanation: Default hysteresis for all areas (configured in Global Settings). Good baseline for most radiator systems.
hysteresisHelp.areaSettingExplanation: Override the global setting for individual areas. Perfect for rooms with floor heating that can use lower values.
hysteresisHelp.veryLowRange: Floor heating systems only - minimal delay but frequent updates
hysteresisHelp.balancedRange: Recommended for radiators - good balance between comfort and equipment protection
hysteresisHelp.highRange: Maximum equipment protection, energy efficient, suitable for slow-response systems
hysteresisHelp.boostTipText: Need immediate heating? Use Boost Mode instead of reducing hysteresis. Boost temporarily overrides all settings to heat quickly without compromising equipment longevity.
